general_requirements.statewide_program_name: Building permit required for projects $20,000+. Electrical contractor license required for all PV. Limited license for installations under $60,000.

interconnection.net_metering_details: Net metering available for systems up to 1 MW. Duke Energy and Dominion Energy are primary utilities. Avoided cost rate for excess generation.
interconnection.fees: Varies by utility; Duke Energy typically $0 for residential interconnection

special_considerations.hoa_restrictions: NC Gen. Stat. 22B-20 prohibits HOA covenants that prevent solar installation.
special_considerations.historic_districts: Additional review required in historic districts.
special_considerations.wind_load_requirements: Coastal areas have enhanced wind requirements. Design wind speeds 100-150 mph on coast.
special_considerations.snow_load_requirements: Mountain areas may have snow load requirements up to 30 psf.

licensing.license_type: NC General Contractors License or Electrical Contractor license. NCLBGC licensing required.

notes: North Carolina is a major solar state ranking #4 nationally in installed capacity. Raleigh offers same-day online permitting for standard residential rooftop systems. Fragmented municipal requirements can extend timelines.
